decks.notes: This deck is focused on utilizing a variety of human creatures with aggressive abilities, supported by cards like Aether Vial for quick deployment and disruption through creatures like Meddling Mage and Reflector Mage. The mana base is carefully structured to support the human tribal theme, with key lands like Cavern of Souls and Unclaimed Territory. The overall strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and disruptive aggro strategy, leveraging the synergy and power of the human creature type.

Aggressively play spells that fill your graveyard and trigger Arclight Phoenix's ability, while supporting it with other powerful cards like Crackling Drake and Thing in the Ice. Utilize card draw and manipulation to find your key pieces quickly, with backup plans like Pyromancer Ascension if necessary. Use Surgical Extraction to disrupt your opponent and protect your own strategy. Maintain a balance between aggression and control, constantly threatening with quick, powerful creatures while disrupting your opponent's game plan. Prioritize tempo and efficiency in your plays to overwhelm your opponent and secure victory.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly reduce your own life total in order to make Death's Shadow a powerful creature while utilizing aggressive creatures and spells to deal damage to your opponent swiftly. This deck combines aggressive strategies with cards that benefit from having a low life total, creating a high-risk, high-reward gameplay style that aims to finish the game before the opponent can stabilize. The deck focuses on fast and efficient plays to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory.

The main concept of this Modern Aggro - Humans deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy using a combination of powerful Human creatures and disruptive spells. By utilizing cards like Champion of the Parish, Thalia's Lieutenant, and Reflector Mage, the deck aims to quickly build a board presence and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of Aether Vial allows for quick creature deployment, while cards like Noble Hierarch and Ancient Ziggurat help to ensure consistent mana production for the deck's creatures.

The deck focuses on utilizing the life total as a resource to power up Death's Shadow and Gurmag Angler quickly, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with efficient targeted removal and hand disruption spells. The deck aims to control the board and protect its threats with Stubborn Denial, while also having access to card advantage through Snapcaster Mage and potential combo finish with Temur Battle Rage. The deck aims to be proactive and aggressive, pressuring the opponent while maintaining a level of disruption to control the game.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly get aggressive creatures onto the battlefield by utilizing cards like Burning Inquiry, Faithless Looting, and Goblin Lore to discard cards and generate value. Hollow One is a key card that can hit the battlefield for free, while Bloodghast and Flamewake Phoenix provide additional threats. The deck also includes removal spells like Fatal Push and Lightning Bolt to deal with opposing creatures. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast, explosive plays and capitalize on the discard and graveyard mechanics.

The deck focuses on quickly building a board of merfolk creatures with the help of lords like Lord of Atlantis and Master of the Pearl Trident. Aether Vial allows for efficient creature deployment while Spreading Seas disrupts the opponent's mana base. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Merfolk Trickster and Mistcaller to handle threats. The key strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of merfolk creatures, leveraging their synergies and tribal abilities to close out the game quickly.

The main concept of this deck revolves around assembling UrzaTron (Urza's Mine, Power Plant, and Tower) to generate large amounts of mana quickly. This allows the player to cast powerful colorless threats such as Karn Liberated, Ugin, the Spirit Dragon, and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. The deck focuses on controlling the game through removal spells like Oblivion Stone and Relic of Progenitus, while also utilizing Ancient Stirrings and Sylvan Scrying to tutor for key pieces and ensure consistency in drawing into threats and land.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana by using cards like Azusa, Lost but Seeking and Amulet of Vigor to play big threats like Primeval Titan early in the game. It also utilizes lands that provide additional bonuses when they enter the battlefield, such as Selesnya Sanctuary and Simic Growth Chamber. The deck can quickly assemble a powerful board state and win through combo plays involving Primeval Titan fetching lands like Slayer's Stronghold and Sunhome, Fortress of the Legion to pump up creatures for swift lethal attacks. It aims to overwhelm the opponent with big threats and efficient mana ramp.

This deck focuses on maximizing graveyard interaction and recursion to quickly overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and direct damage spells. By using cards like Faithless Looting and Cathartic Reunion to fill the graveyard, along with Life from the Loam to repeatedly put lands into play, the deck aims to bring back creatures like Bloodghast, Prized Amalgam, and Narcomoeba for continuous pressure. The deck also uses Creeping Chill to drain the opponent's life total while setting up lethal Conflagrate finishes. With careful management of resources and a good understanding of sequencing, this deck can be incredibly explosive and hard to stop.

This deck focuses on utilizing the graveyard as a resource to quickly fill it with key cards like Bloodghast, Narcomoeba, and Prized Amalgam. By leveraging cards like Faithless Looting and Cathartic Reunion to discard cards and trigger abilities, you can quickly bring back creatures from the graveyard to overwhelm your opponent. Using Life from the Loam to repeatedly return lands to your hand and dredge cards for value, while also using cards like Conflagrate and Creeping Chill to close out the game.

This Eldrazi Aggro deck focuses on deploying powerful Eldrazi creatures quickly to overwhelm the opponent. With a mix of aggressive creatures like Reality Smasher and efficient disruption like Thought-Knot Seer and Chalice of the Void, this deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while quickly putting pressure on the board. The inclusion of cards like Serum Powder and Gemstone Caverns helps to ensure consistent mana production and allows for explosive starts. Overall, this deck looks to apply early pressure and maintain board control to secure a swift victory.

The deck focuses on playing aggressive human creatures quickly and efficiently, utilizing mana-fixing lands and creatures like Noble Hierarch to ramp up. By using cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Meddling Mage to disrupt opponents' plans, along with Aether Vial to cheat creatures onto the battlefield, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and powerful board presence. Reflector Mage and Deputy of Detention provide removal options, while cards like Thalia's Lieutenant pump up the team for a strong finish.

This deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with spells like Faithless Looting and Serum Visions to bring back powerful creatures like Arclight Phoenix and utilize Pyromancer Ascension for extra value. The deck utilizes cheap and efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Flame Slash to control the board while also benefiting from spells that cantrips like Opt and Thought Scour. Its goal is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells while maintaining card advantage and graveyard manipulation.

This Golgari Aggro deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's hand with cards like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize, while also using efficient removal spells like Assassin's Trophy and Fatal Push to control the board. The deck also aims to apply pressure with efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf and Dark Confidant, while utilizing Liliana of the Veil for additional disruption and removal. The deck's mana base is designed to support a consistent curve and ensure reliable access to both green and black sources of mana.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through the efficient use of counterspells, bounce effects, and powerful threats. By assembling the UrzaTron lands, the deck can generate large amounts of mana to cast game-ending spells like Ugin, the Spirit Dragon and Wurmcoil Engine. The variety of tutor effects allows for flexibility in finding key cards, while the inclusion of artifacts like Mindslaver and Oblivion Stone provide additional control options. The deck aims to stall the game until it can establish a dominant board presence and secure the win.
